content:
26, 2014
												You are Gordon Freeman. A scientist who works for the Black Mesa facility. And an experiment you took part in has gone completely awry, unleashing an extraterestrial invasion, and now all hell has broken loose in Black Mesa. Your main goal is to survive and to stop the invasion, using the help of surviving Black Mesa employees, whatever you can get your hands on and your own bare wits.Even if it is over a decade old, Half Life has aged very, very well. In fact it seems to do some things better than most Modern shooters - you can hold a heck of a lot of weapons for example, a great feature that barely has any presence in shooters nowadays. The gunplay is intense but fair, and you have a huge multitude of weapons to utilise - and they are all great and feel powerful. Enemy types are plentiful, varied and can get pretty darn tough as the game progresses. The enemy AI itself is intelligent and fierce - especially the soldiers who know how to flank well and work together. There are friendly NPC's as well, which are actually helpful: Security guards can help deliver covering fire and scientists can unlock doors and heal you if you are low on health. The game also takes good advantage of the environmental elements around it, technically making almost everything a threat or obstacle - some bridges can be destroyed which may require you to find another way around it, wet floors are obviously slippy so you need to be careful not to slide into an elevator shaft - Did I also mention that elevators in this game are barely ever safe? All of these great uses of particular stage elements called for some fantastically designed levels and puzzles that require a skilled gamer to complete.Graphically, I will admit the game does look a bit blocky by today's standards and the character animations are pretty wooden, but each level within Half Life looks worlds apart from one another, especially the last part of the game, trust me, it's amazing, that's all I'm saying about it, I'm not gonna spoil it. The character and enemy designs themselves, most notably the aliens, are really creative, unique and varied. The real time cutscenes were cutting edge back in the day and even though the choppy and kinda unexistant character animations during these cutscenes are now dated in a sense, the fact that they are REAL TIME just makes them very immersive and makes you feel part of a great story.When it comes to audio, the soundeffects are great and fits Half Life's sci-fi tone, and the guns are LOUD. The music tracks, although few and far between, are fantastic and give off great atmosphere. The voiceacting is also great, even if the recordings are a bit grainy.If there was anything I thought that did detract from the overall quality from the game, is the fact that sometimes the player can get glitched in certain parts of the environment, so they can't move, therefore they would need to restart from the last save... but then again this barely ever happens.Tl;dr Half Life is a groundbreaking FPS that has stood the test of time and I still consider it as one of the best shooters ever made, if not the best. An immersive, action packed, incredibly varied FPS that makes you feel like an action hero. Highly recommended to anyone who has at least an interest in videogames.

er 4, 2012
												Half-Life does something no game has ever done before. It become popular among people that never even played it.Counter-Strike. Day of Defeat. Team Fortress. The Specialists. Natural Selection. I could go on listing the great mods, and games, that has come about as a result of Half-Life. It is not just a single game, when you buy Half-Life you are buying literally hundreds of games.Half-Life is an impressive game in it's own right too, the graphics were amazing for the time and the gameplay and story were great but that all pales in comparison to what this game has done for the world of gaming in general.This is what made modding popular. This is why games today have mod support and why mods sometimes become games.The next time you play a game with mods, with plugins, with graphical enhancement, with fan made maps, with total conversions. The next time you play a game that used to be mod. Say thanks to Half-Life.Half-Life didn't event modding. It made it popular.

												The first time I came in contact with Half-Life was around 1999, I used to watch my brother play this game, to say the least I was amazed by the graphics and HL world back then. Some time later I started to play the game myself, as a real noob, I was pretty bad at it, occasionally playing multiplayer with my brother and friends, I was usually the worst of them (having the worst score). As time passed and I started to play CS 1.6, then HL2 and CSS, gradually getting better and better at every aspect of the game. Becoming a CSS regular, I became familiar with CS mods (DR, MG, ZM, BHOP...), having a few thousand hours in CSS.Today, replaying the first Half-Life I came to realize how much of an impact this game had on the whole series, inspiring most of the mods known to todays Counter-Strike community.Beside a very interesting story line, it has a diverse world, completely voiced dialog, awesome weapons and monsters and a legendary status in my book.no less than a 10/10

content:
r 7, 2015
												Half-Life is a science fiction first-person shooter video game developed by Valve Corporation, the company's first game product and the first in the Half-Life series. Released in 1998 by Sierra Studios , in Half-Life, you assume the role of Dr. Gordon Freeman, a theoretical physicist who must fight his way out of a secret underground research facility whose research and experiments into teleportation technology have gone disastrously wrong. Half-Life is a first-person shooter that requires the player to perform combat tasks and puzzle solving to advance through the game. Compared to most first-person shooters of the time, which relied on cut-scene intermissions to detail their plotlines, Half-Life‍ '​s story is told entirely by means of scripted sequences, keeping you in control of the first-person viewpoint. In line with this, the game has no cut-scenes, and you rarely loses the ability to control Gordon, who never speaks and is never actually seen in the game; the player sees "through his eyes" for the entire length of the game. It also has multiplayer and because this is not the original version, it comes with an HD texture pack, which looks gorgeous in game. Although having not played on an actual servers I have played LAN with one of my friends and in my first experience I thought it was spot on, there are so much maps and also many weapons for you to use. Overall I would give Half-Life a rating of 9/10 stars, for a 1998 game this is absolutely fantastic . The story is very interesting and fun to play through, you feel like you really are playing as Gordon this is an absolutely must buy for a price of $6 you are getting such a great deal. I am absolutely 100% sure without a doubt that Half-Life will just blow you away!.

I also like how when you blow a body up, the body parts go flying in bits and pieces, unlike some of these newer games where you blow something up and they just go flying as a whole(or nothing happens).... It's got an interesting storyline I guess. Those aliens remind me of the flood from Halo....hahaha Yeah overal, I suppose I liked it.===========================Played on "The Beast"i7-3970x, 64GB RAM, 2x GTX 770s 4GB VRAM, WinXP x64 Pro, 4x SSDs, 2x HDDs, Rampage IV Extreme, X-Fi Titanium Fatal1ty Pro, custom water loop, 2x BD-drives, TJ07-BW, 850W PSU, and many fans! Resolution: 2560x1600

												around the time this game was released there were two types of video game story types. There was The Doom style, you know that stuff you mistake for credits in between blowing ♥♥♥♥ up. There was MGS, which felt the need to beat you with exposition until you began to feel like you were a Horse. who was dying. But narrative, true narrative, is not blowing ♥♥♥♥ up or exposition. It is what half life does. Storytelling through gameplay. It is not a simple shooting gallery, nor is it a movie where you have to do ♥♥♥♥ to get past the commercials. It is a game where gameplay and story are inseperable. Half-Life would be dull as a film. And what would it be without the G-Man? I had never played this game before, but I had heard of it. everyone has. It is considered the best of 90's PC gaming(well, it and Deus Ex.) It nails gameplay and storytelling. the tale is compelling, with action, suspense, and a hidden element of mystery.

												This game has been legendary since it's release in 1998, it has won over 50 game of the year of awards. If you have a pc of any kind, get this game. Because the story is good, it runs on a potato, there is fast-paced fun multiplayer, supports mods that make the game way better, and the whole game is fun.And if you don't have another reason for half-life then heres this: Half-Life SDK. The ultimate tool to putting your ideas from pen to paper, to a three-dimensional world that supports 32-bit coloured textures, ambient sounds that is really immersive, a top-notch visibility engine so everymap you play in is optimized for your pc, and aswell as high-poly models that can be created. Half-Life SDK WILL be in your LIBRARY-TOOLS folder upon buying Half-Life, for only 10 dollars.And in courtesy of Mapcore.org and Game Bannana, you can download maps to enhance your experience, or why not install a mod where you play as another black mesa employee, trying to escape the HECU marines aswell as the Xen creatures.I will never regret purchasing this game, it has filled me with experiences that I can always relive with a click of the blue PLAY button that sits in your library as you are bored and want to play a fun game. Buy this game, I don't care if your broke, get a small loan from the mafia or get a big one from the bank, just buy it.10/10 -ShoXiN

content:
er 24, 2016
												The "Test Of Time" Award. Hands. Down. You know the game deserves one, when you didn't even finish reading the description of the award and alredy on the way to nominate this timeless classic. This game holds a lot of nostalgic value for me. As well as being the first game I even bought for Steam, back when it was nothing but basically a client for playing and buying/activating Valve Games. Despite all that bias, this game, without any doubt, deserves it's praises in full. The list of "pros" this game has is vast, but I believe the biggest and most important accomplishment of this game is it's impact on the FPS genre and gaming world in general. Half-Life was a pioneer of it's time. This game to the FPS genre is like Black Sabbath to the world of Heavy Metal. It's like Isaac Newton to the world of physics and mathematics. The world would've continue without them, but it would not be the same, lacking all of things that have been build upon and inspired by their accomplishments. TL;DR - it's a good game, you might want to check it. That is, if you're not too squeamish about grandpa's graphics.

content:
, 2014
												This game is a masterpiece. I'm pretty sure I'm not the first to say that, but it really feels like one. Many things in this game make it what it is. First, the gameplay in this game is just marvelous, you can't feel closer to the game with its amazing mechanisms, shooting, jumping and everything you can do, it just feels right. It seems like it's really you that controls the game and that the final result, good or bad, is always the product of your moves. With great shooting and movement mechanisms, everything feels right.Secondly, another thing you can't complain about this game: its story. The story of Half-Life, the one that gave birth to this amazing franchise, is just a beautiful piece of work. It fully accomplishes its mission to take you to another world. With the fact that, Gordon Freeman, the character which you control, is entirely in your possession feels like you are in this story and you have the power to change it. The game doesn't even have cutscenes so everything is seen from your point of view. The story is captivating; it treats the alien subject differently from most stories told on this subject. It contains a government trying to hide the alien-incident, a mysterious G-Man (the man who always watches you) and a chaotic man vs alien battlefield. Maybe after all, they're not what we thought... So many questions will fly around your head and will give you the desire to continue this mysterious story.Thirdly, I have to talk about the graphics and the level design. Those both, like everything I said before, are just truly great. While the graphics may be considered "ugly" or "old", they are for me still beautiful even if this game is from 1998. The game has great details, textures and colors. Just imagine how it felt back in the days. For the level design, nothing as changed. What I mean by that, is even after more than a decade, the levels are still pure genius and are so well used that you need to think and to familiarize with them so you can use them as your advantage. I have to tell you that this game isn't like most of the games today and is longer, which is really nice, because you'll want this game to never end. There is also a multiplayer mode which can be fun, but, as you guessed it, is mostly dead. From a negative point of view, I don't have a lot to say. For the people that won't like the graphics, you can always buy the Black Mesa game, which is the same thing, but updated for the new generations (or old time fans). All I can say in the end, is that this game is a must!

The game that started a cult..Half-life is first-person, adventure game developed by Valve Software. You play as Gordon Freeman, a research assistant who just arrived at Black Mesa (a research company) on his first day at work. content:
er 3, 2014
												NOTE: This review is only for the single-player campaign.In 1998, a first-person shooter called Half-Life was released by a virtually unknown startup company called Valve. It shattered sales records, shot to the top of the review charts,won over 50 Game of the Year awards, and redefined the FPS genre. Yet, how does it hold up today?Graphics: Half-Life's graphics, while stunning back in 1998, have aged very poorly. Textures are blurry, and character models are blocky (even with the HD Texture pack from 2001.) The lighting has aged somewhat better than the rest of the game although it is still dated. Black Mesa itself is rather boring to look at, as it is mostly gray corridors and vent shafts which is a shame because that is where the majority of the game takes place. The desert outside and the levels set on Xen are far more interesting in design though. For me though, graphics are the last thing that I pay attention to in a game, so it's by no means a deal breaker for me. Gameplay: Ah, now here is where Half-Life's meat is (along with its story.) It was universally praised for its polished and fun mix of shooting and puzzles, and for raising the standards of FPS gameplay completely. In my opinion, some of this praise still holds true, but Half-Life's gameplay has aged well in some aspects and not so well in others.By far, the best aged part of the gameplay is the shooting. It still feels good after 16 years, with a nice variety of weapons that are all fun to use (shotgun FTW!) and continue to remain useful throughout the 10 hour campaign. There are a nice variety of enemies, too, from the Xen aliens (all with different attacks,) and the HECU Marines, who at the time were considered to have some of the most advanced AI in any game, and still pose a challenge to fight (although this is more due to their incredibly annoying tendency to move around a ton making them hard to hit then for their AI.) There are also boss fights, a staple of 90's FPS's. Thankfully, these boss fights are mostly done well, with the exception that I feel that the final boss's solution is a bit too obtuse. What hasn't aged well are the puzzles. While I don't mind puzzles in FPS games to mix up the gameplay, the puzzles here are platforming puzzles, another 90's staple. These puzzles feel like they really break up the otherwise great pacing of the game, and I always feel a bit annoyed whenever one comes across. However, they are thankfully short and shouldn't be a huge problem to master. The game also includes friendly NPCs, another reason it was lauded, but these NPCs are rather useless except to move the plot along.  Overall, Half-Life's gameplay is still enjoyable, even if it does feel a bit dated.Story/Atmosphere: The other reason Half-Life was so well-received was for its (at the time,) immersive atmosphere and well-written story. This still holds true, mostly. You play as Gordon Freeman, Theoretical Physicist and employee of the top-secret Back Mesa Research Facility, a government facility deep beneath the New Mexico desert. During a normal day at work, an experiment goes horribly wrong, causing a fictional "resonance cascade" and opening a tear between Black Mesa and the alien borderworld of Xen. You must find a way to close the dimensional tear and save Earth, while battling the hostile aliens and US soldiers sent by the government to liquidate the personnel and cover up the incident. The plot itself, although rather simple, is still well-written and still solid even today. Even with some hilariously entertaining voice-acting it still gets its hooks into you and manages to keep you interested for the well-executed twist ending. The atmosphere, however, still holds up very well. Even with the bad graphics, Half-Life remains immersive partially due to the fact that there are no cutscenes, leaving you in control of Gordon the entire time, and partially due to the fact that it still has some great sound design. This game was considered to be very scary when it came out, and although that has faded away, the game can still startle you when a headcrab leaps out from a vent or when a Vortigaunt comes hissing around the corner and fries you with green energy. The soundtrack is also very minimal, barely playing at all during the game, although what you do hear sounds fairly nice, with a techno beat.Overall, Half-Life is an game that, while it may not look pretty, still plays well and combined with an immersive atmosphere and well-told (albeit unoriginal,) plot, combines to create an enjoyable well-crafted, if a bit dated, experience.

												This game is a classic. It doesn't matter if I recommend it or not, you should probably at least try it.As most of you know, you are Gordon Freeman, scientist or something from Black Mesa and you basically save the ♥♥♥♥ing world. This first-person shooter combines a wide variety of weapons - Assault rifles, SMGs, pistols, grenades and crowbars with an amazing story and perfectly crafted levels. I understand why this game is regarded as a classic, the levels are truly made beautifully.Aside from being a great single player game, it also spawned a lot of community made mods, which were later created into standalone games. Popular ones like Counter-Strike, Day of Defeat, Team Fortress Classic and even Ricochet all started from Half-Life.To be honest, though, with the amount of praise it gets, I somehow expected a lot more, even though I knew it's an old game and I was a bit disappointed. Movement also felt a bit slippery.Overall, It's definitely not a bad idea to buy it.

content:
4, 2014
												The game is so attachable that you'll forget it was made in 1998. The intro is just amazing, as you're toured through a science facility full of robots and testers walking around. As you walk through the facility into the test chamber, it just feels so interactive and real.When you put the sample into that bolt, the game really gets going. I especially love how you're teleported to a planet for a few seconds, then back to earth again. It's like a first person movie. It's just you and the game, no video to interupt the gameplay.As you get deeper in the story you're more eager to see what is has to offer. It's as if the game possesed you.The game is definitley one of the best ever made, and in some ways I enjoy it more than HL2.You'll never get bored playing it. Guarunteed.

content:
r 31, 2016
												If you have not played this game, then you have never experienced life. This is the finest work of art in storytelling and visuals you will get in your entire life. Half Life comes from a time where effort in games was a thing, and Valve created this symphony in such a perfect form, to allow the game of the century to be born. The game has aged fantastically, the visuals are intense and intriguing, and keep a surprisingly realistic feel for the limited hardware at the time, 1997-1998. It's amazingly natural to be immersed into this game.Pros - Everything in this game is pleasure at its most pure.Cons - Why the bloody hell don't you own Half Life?!Rating - 1,000,000/10(I have a low amount of hours since my Steam account is relatively new as of 2016. I primarily played the disc version of Half Life as well as the Playstation 2 version, while owning the Steam version since 2013 on a different account.

y 9, 2011
												The game that brought one of the modern monoliths of gaming to where it is, Half-Life is a Thoroughly enjoyable romp through the Black Mesa Research Facility, a Underground scientific haven (albiet lacking in OSHA compliance)  turned to a subterranean deathtrap after a teleportation experiment gone awry.The GoldSrc Engine -- the game engine Half-Life runs on, and forerunner to the more modern Source engine -- still provides fresh experiences more than a decade after release through a healthy modding community, with such gems as 'Afraid of Monsters', 'Sven Co-Op', 'They Hunger', and dozens of other great mods running on the beloved Quakeworld derivative.This game is worth the low amount Valve asks for it - Go ahead, take the plunge!

content:
y 23, 2015
												Came out roughly sixteen years ago now. Revolutionized the FPS genre and how it handles story telling. Is it still worth playing? ♥♥♥♥ yes it is. The guns are loud, powerful and satisfying, the enemies are fun to fight, have decent AI and look really cool, the story is somewhat minimal but handled in a way that communicates sufficient information to the player and simultaneously doesn't interrupt the gameplay too much which lets the game keep a very fast pace and has a slight air of mysterious freakiness about it, and the level design is solid aside from some first-person platforming and most of Xen. Might be worth waiting for Black Mesa to be finished, but Half-Life 1 is still a pretty fun, excellently designed and tight game on it's own.

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
er 6, 2014
												An excellent game in its own right. Valves first masterpiece which inspired the sequels (HL2, Ep 1 & 2) and countless mods throughout the series, such as the acclaimed Team Fortress 2 and Portal.The player starts of as a researcher in Black Mesa running late to work. After the Gordon Freeman, the character the player controls, reaches the test he is supposed to participate in he is immediately put to work. This has cataclysmic consequences, and Gordon Freeman is then forced to defend Black Mesa from an alien invasion and, eventually, the military, all the while being followed by the mysterious G-man.In terms of gameplay, Half-Life is very simple. You have health and suit power, a variety of guns and hopeully some aim. Starting with a crowbar and ending with a laser, you will shoot your way through Black Mesa, solving simple puzzles and navigating sometimes complex coridoors.The plot is simple yet effective, as is the gameplay. Overall, a very satisfying game, and worth checking out regardless of reviews, due to its impact.

												Half-Life is quite possibly one of the most important first-person shooters ever created. You're not a space marine: you're a scientist fighting for your life. You truly feel alone when your only companion--be it a scientist or one of the many security guards trapped with you--bites the dust, leaving you to fend for yourself. Seamlessly flowing from cinematics to action, there are no cutscenes: the control is never taken from you. Your journey through Black Mesa begins.

content:
er 13, 2010
												While DOOM really established the FPS, it was Half-Life that really took it to the next level. Valve created something so amazing, so different to anything else on the market at the time. Not a straight up shooter, but one where you were actually IN a story. Events were happening around you, and you were participating in them. Enemies were not just wheeled out wave after wave, they were smarter. Things happened when you seemed to be walking down an empty corridor, nothing was straightforward in this game. Many features in Half-Life will now seem standard, but next to DOOM, this is the game that changed the FPS in to what it is today. But while playing DOOM might only provide you with some retro nostalgia for a few minutes, Half-Life is still a very playable classic.

content:
14, 2016
												half-life 1 possibly the greatest FPS ever made (sue me COD fanboys) when i was a teenager i wasted literally years of time in this game on my old 350Mhz pentium 2 tower with 64MB of RAM in 640x480 res with a 2MB graphics cardthis is a classic and no real review is required but for completion sake i will write one anyway pros:this game will run on literally any computer made after 2000 even without a dedicated GPUmultiplayer is fun when you can find someone to play withthe graphics still hold up today in my opinion if you use direct 3D or open GL mode at max resthe level design was exquisite for its time and is still good today you get a wide range of weapons to use from the legendary crowbar to an alien beehive (did i mention i hate bees!!!)the gore from falls and explosions (or even the crowbar) is still unmatched in detail by most modern games the voice acting is really good for the time by adjusting the text in the speech files sometimes you can make characters swear at youyou can even shoot a tanks main cannon and watch alien guts fly everywhere the rerplay value is high on this one and i would play it any day cons:it sometimes doesnt work properly on newer computers and operating systems most of the time you will have ammo for the guns that are all but useless late in the game (ever played shotgun vs helicopter?)the end boss is near impossible to beat the first time until you look up a walkthroughthe protection missions (protect this scientist from aliens) are hard as ♥♥♥♥ because tanking is not a useful tacticheadcrabs come out of nowhere before you can shoot them so you WILL take damage bottom line: get this game get this game get this game why are you still reading this get this game get this game seriously what are you waiting for vote this review as helpful and buy the game its only a dollar or 2

content:
22, 2016
												When I first gave Half Life a shot, I thought to myself: This was released in 1998? Because I was very impressed with what was developed almost 2 decades ago. The original Half Life is nothing short of amazing for the single player experience that many shooters today wish they had. I was able to understand the story here more than in Half Life 2, and actually being inside Black Mesa when something goes horribly wrong. Half Life also has extensive DLC content to add to the overall gameThe Original Half Life gets a 9/10. You get get this game along with the Half Life Collection for $5 when on sale. I recommend the Original Half Life for those who are looking for a great single-player experience.Until next review!    ~Stealth 1548

number of helpful: 3 of 4 people (75%) found this review helpful
content:
er 2, 2014
												This is such a fun game even though it came out in 1998. But it does have its fair share of pros and cons.The main thing i loved about this game is the amont of variety in it, at one point you'll be fighting three gaint claws then hinding from a helicopter in a mine field, then fighting a huge fish underwater with a crossbow. You'll be faced with something new every time, which is somthing most games need to stay fun. Another great thing was the amount of different wepons you keep finding thoughout the entire game, so by the end you have somthing like 20 different wepons (with most of then having a right click secondary fire).The graphics in the game were terrible (but it was made in 1998 so thats ok). The level design was ok (but sometimes you crouch lower then you thought was posible). There is no sprint, only nomal, walk and crouch. The AI sucked, because they somtimes have too fast or too slow reactions, it's really hard to sneak up on them, they occasionly shoot at you before they've finished turning to face you, and some enemys kill you instantly (but your speed make up for most of these problems with the AI). I couldn't understand the plot most of the time (because there is no cut scenes) and the ending was a bit disappointing, it was slightly to sudden.Most of these problems were because it came out in 1998.Which doesn't matter because i loved the game7.5/10

number of helpful: 3 of 4 people (75%) found this review helpful
content:
4, 2014
												Quake 2's younger brother that went on to throw valve into the lime lightWhile fast paced and simple, Half-Life comes off as a bore to me now that I've given it a good clean run through again. While it's story never breaks line from Gordon's perspective, they don't elaborate on any of the characters or enviroments at all, making interaction with scientists and guards either "keep them alive" or "waste them for laughs".Level design, however, is this games strong point. Every map is huge and expansive, with some great texture work for a game released in 1998. The Dam scene remains one of my favorite uses of Quake II engine technology to this day.It's basically Quake 2 in lab settings. The most interesting chapter is probably Xen, with it's bizarre landscapes.Multiplayer isn't horrible.7/10 it's good

content:
er 2, 2015
												The Most Important achievements in Video Game HistoryWolfenstein and Doom Created the basic of the first person gaming experience. Opening doors and searching for key became the standard for the genre it self. (Quake, Duke 3d, Shadow warrior ect)But on November 8, 1998 Half Life Change everything. It was no longer about searching for keys it became more about A First Person Narrative that didn't exist before in the gaming industry. There was no cut sceen only direct contact whit the environment and caracters that you encounterd. It was a personal story about crowbars, jumping, crawling in vent and survival. The user/player was Gordon freeman, you have a PHD in theoretical physics, you blew up the microwave of you colleague and  yes you brought chaos at Black Mesa, before the even began.It was a Daring Aproache but one that paid off, it was a changing point in the FPS genre and viewed by many has one of the Best Video Game ever made.In this day and age The FPS Genre is the Cow Milk of the industry and game like Half Life are Rare and are not the standart of the Gaming industry but they should be. 10/10: Verdict: A MasterPiece There is no reason for me to convice you to play this game in 2015 but if you like First person shooters and you did not play this game, then Grab your Crowbars and enjoy this Masterpiece.Ps: If you think that the Graphics are Outdated then you are in Luck there are excellent mods that update the visuals. Mod DB will be your friend.

content:
9, 2015
												EA really ♥♥♥♥ the bed with this one. Ever since the release of the greatest and first shooter video game ever, South Park: The Game, EA has been trying to dismantle the lead that Square Enix deservingly took with their masterpiece. It was apparent that EA took heavily from Square Enix's SP:TG (as us educated game critics call it) with the release of their lowest rated video game ever released, Legend of Zelda: Ocarina of Time, which is essentially SP:TG with a tower defense/RTS element haphazardly implemented. Half-Life may be the worst video game I've ever played, but it still holds a place in my heart. This game represents the downfall of EA, who had brought in the past relatively ok RPGs such as Glover, Alladin, and Space Channel 5: Part 2. Half-Life is the bottom line. Everyone should play this game, if only to steer clear of accidentally doing something that this game did if they plan on developing a game. There is no redeemable quality to be had here. 9/10

												Half-Life is a FPS, but not a average FPS, this game brings in shooting and platforming at the right times, sometimes managing the jumping puzzles can be hard, even when the answer is in plain sight and hard to see, completing it feels satisfying. The game can be difficult espically at times when coming to some parts (unless your on easy) making that feel good when you complete it too. Overall, being one of the best (and first!) Valve Software games ever, this game gets a 9/10.[EDIT 3/13/2015]Just to convince you even more how good this game is, i'm gonna list some mods for this game.CRACK-LIFEPlay through a skinned Half-Life game to make it feel like you're on crack.SVEN-COOPHave you ever wanted to play Half-Life or it's expansions with your friends?Well now you can with this mod!And not only do you get the campaign support, you also get custom maps too!Plus, you can play Crack-Life with it!I'll add more later.

number of helpful: 4 of 6 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
10, 2016
THIS GAME SCORES [0 1 | 2 *3*] = ~88% (75%-100%)It was great back then when it came out, one of those ground-breaker games that showed us what could be done in a video game. A shooter where you're not actually constantly shooting but also experience some civilized situations, like e.g. at the beginning of Doom 3, allowing a much deeper sense of immersion and role-playing.HL is also one of the first 3D 1st person games to have scripted events. It was pretty revolutionary back then to see e.g. how a laser wandering around the room destroys equipment just when you're in the right place to witness it.Much love went into making this game. Sometimes I believe that the actual intention/attitude somehow reflects in a work, not just the craftsmanship. See also System Shock 2 - at least that's how I explain a good portion of its magic.If you want to play it today for the game instead of as an attempt to find out what the people back then might have experienced, play Black Mesa instead. It's a worthy remake of Half-Life.

number of helpful: 4 of 6 people (67%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
er 6, 2015
												i give this game : 9.6i was watching a video ( a game review ) by some one who was saying how good was counter strike and how bad was global offenssive, saying therse no improvement whatsoever, and after playing both game i agree with him.But we all know that half life is like the single player story mode of counter strike.They share the same engine, the same graphics, the same content, and the same ai and gameplay and son on and on...so i finished half life ! now the guy in the video was stating that no one knew why counter strike was good so no one could make it better which seemed right at the time.but after finishing half life i understood why counter strike (10/10) was so Good !!!If developers make a game and dont be concered about graphics and be concered about the LAW and MATH of EVERY SINGLE CONTENT that ever come to a game from code to its last detail and put all the assets on a similar scale a new counter strike will be REBORN !UPDATE : THIS HAS ALMOST HAPPENED AND ITS CALLED RAINBOW SIX SIEGE NOW !now to the game itself :i promise you even if u play this game RIGHT NOW u  will ENJOY THE HELL OUT OF IT.The game is old schooled , just the way i like it, its hard, you cant just press buttons to pass, you actually have to be a hero !And NO NO NO your character in game shouldnt be BATMAN or superman or glueman or any other crappy man for that matter, YOU THE PLAYER SHOULD BE THE HERO !The game test your skills, requires you to be smart and fast, give a nice story for its game and gameplay and year it was made.The graphics are old but due to lack of particles, which is a good thing, you wont tyre your eyes all the time to simulate an effect with no good use, you can play the game in long hours easily, and believe me it will require LONG hours to finish !if u play a little the game attracts you and you wouldnt mind the graphics anyway.But at first it will be a little odd, but i think there is a remastered in hd version on steam called black mesa, so you can play that too, but i had to experience the original thing first .This is the hardcore PC game you are looking for !i give this game : 9.6reviewed by IMMORTALEADER

content:
1, 2015
												I honestly don't know why you're reading a review for Half-Life instead of buying it and all the other HL games, but anyway, since there are so many reviews already explaining why it's good, I'm just not gonna do that. Instead I'll just write the story of why I bought it, or mainly how I got into Steam Way back in 2012 when I was first introduced to the internet and memes, I had seen many Half Life 3 memes and I was curious as to why it was so popular, but I never bothered to research it and just went along with it. Eventually, in 2013, I created a Steam account (or maybe it was in late 2012) because of people talking about TF2 and I wanted to see what made it so great, so I downloaded TF2 and I didn't really understand how to play or what I was doing then I lost my login credentials to my Steam account and created 2 more before I finally got to this one. I didn't use Steam much at the time other than to play TF2 and I got my friends involved, too. After a while I went outside my TF2 bubble and started browsing games during a Christmas sale and bought 2 games that got a lot of attention on the internet as well, Fallout 3 and Skyrim. I played them almost 24/7 and then summer came and the 2014 summer sale started, but I had to miss out because I spent 2/3 of the summer away from home. When I came home I got back on Steam and then in August school started up, but that didn't stop me from browsing Steam and building a wishlist (I rarely got money at the time) and I found half-Life and all the other Half-Life games so I wishlisted them all. As time passed, my library grew, my wishlist shrunk, but the Half-Life games always stayed. Then, sometime in March I bought a $20 Steam wallet card and used it to buy a $10 game off my wishlist and I saved the rest for when I had more money to get a more expensive game. Then next week Lego games went on sale and I added another $5 to my account so I had $15, enough to get the Lego Batman trilogy (or at least one of the 2 I didn't own) but then I realized I could get the complete HL 1 anthology for $15 so I bought it, and played Half-Life then fell in love with the series

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful2 people found this review funny
content:
y 10, 2016
												I'll be honest; I didn't love Half-Life at first.Maybe it was the fact that I played this game in 2016, 18 years after its initial release in 1998. Perhaps it was the serviceable but definitely outdated controls  I had to deal with, along with some annoying bugs and glitches. It didn't click for me. But after about an hour of getting used to everything, here's what I realized: Half-Life is real nice. Almost everything wrong with the game comes from technological limitations of the 90s. Graphics really start to show the wear-and-tear of 18 years; but they aren't bad enough to distract from the general gameplay. I can't make any more complaints about Half-Life simply because the sum of its parts makes it such a good game. The story still entertains and is delivered well, throwing out lengthy cutscenes and text crawls in favor of gameplay-based storytelling. Enemy AI was amazing for its time and still functions well today; a variety of weapons and unique, challenging level designs keep things interesting through the course of this game. Most importantly, Half-Life retains a remarkable sense of immersion. You do things of your own volition - you never feel like the game is telling you to do something. The best and most surprising aspect of this is its genuine difficulty. Make no mistake about it, scrubs: Half-Life is HARD. The game will throw you in tough situations that make you get off your silly high horse and think; try to play this game with the Doom mentality of run-and-gun and you'll get instantly wrecked by its puzzles and smart enemy placement. Playing through Half-Life in 2016 was a chore; it was a struggle. Most importantly, though? It was a genuinely fascinating, enjoyable little 10+ hour trip into the world of an FPS that revolutionized EVERYTHING in the world of video games upon its release. If it were remastered and retweaked today (read: Black Mesa), it would still be one of the best shooters of any generation of gaming.A definite must-play if you want to stop being a filthy scrub.Rating: 7 spooky alien baby-heads out of 10.

content:
er 11, 2015
												this game is an absolute classic, and a classic at that.the level of immersion and architectual/aesthetic brilliance that went into making this game look the way it does now, still holds today, along with amazing amounts of replay value and silly mods that make the game all the more fun is, just amazing, how much it can enhance an already great experience. i know, I only have 1.2 hours on this account, but I can assure you i've played a little over 100, and haven't regretted a single hourit moves well, it shoots well, and overall, it's just fantastic. it discards the use of typical "quicktime" or portions of the game that are triggered to play a cutscene, and uses "scripted sequences" as a way of progressing through the game's storyline, which imo, adds to the already fantastic, fluid and straight-forward level of immersion this game creates for the playerthe feeling of progression, in a previously normal, yet semi not-so innocuous test research facility, located in the arid, and barren deserts of New Mexico, now overrun by hostile wildlife that once inhabited Xen after a failed experiment with the massive Anti-mass-spectrometer, all hell breaks loose, and you have to find your way out, through a series of brilliantly crafted corridors, large industrial toxic plants, treacherous cliffsides, across huge, immersive dams. and of course, the alien world inhabiting all the creatures you encountered, Xen. a huge interplanetary dimensional borderworld, scattered with large, floating rock structures to explore, of course, the designers at valve making us all ♥♥♥ immediately with their attention to detail...if anything this game, undoubtedly deserves the highest mark,  solid 10/10NEED IVAN THE SPACE BIKER FOR BEST EXPERIENCE ♥♥♥ U LAIDLAW BRING BACK IVAN DA SPACE BIKER 9/10

content:
er 26, 2016
												HALF-LIFE! This FPS may look dated to some, but to others? Best game to date. Why? Because nostalgia. Even if you haven't played it before, it's still one heck of an experience, one that every fan of FPSes should experience. If you don't enjoy this game, that's ok. I respect your opinion, but chances are if you're reading this you haven't played this, or you're considering purchasing this game in comparison to some other game. Now, I won't go into detail on the story, because the story is best experienced in person. Before I go any further, you MUST understand that this game has been remade from scratch to look, and play to today's standards. Same game, much better. "But you haven't told me just what this miracle is called!" It's called Black Mesa (Real clever name there, eh?) If you're looking for graphics, but you want to play this game, look at that, the team did an amazing job on Black Mesa, but clearly you're still here, on the original.So, the story? I won't go into detail on that, as previously mentioned, as the story has much more impact when you don't know what's going to happen before entering the world of Half-Life. This is true for both versions of this game.Looking for a Half-Life remastering made by a team of professionals? Go for Black Mesa.Looking for the original made by a team of geniuses nearly 20 years ago? Go for the original, the best, Half-Life.Half-Life is the game that started it all, the 3D FPS Genre was redefined by this game. Players were in for a real treat when they first got this, and that experience can still be had by players around the world today. My opinion? I'd go for Black Mesa, but preferably, I'd play the original, then the remastered version.10/10 Best game from 1998.By the way, be prepared to get stuck in this game numerous times. It's a puzzle game too, y'know.

content:
ry 23, 2016
												I can't say I've had much experience with FPS games or games from the 90s. But I can definitely tell this game has aged very well. The graphics are great and the textures, while a bit dated, are beautiful in a way. There's nothing like stepping outside and seeing the mountains and sky-- especially after being inside tunnels for hours.The gameplay is smooth, exciting, and extremely satisfying. I mean, there's really nothing like electrocuting a giant alien monster to death with rather large tesla coils. In all seriousness, the levels are ingeneous, with new twists around every corner. The puzzles are simple, yet clever, which is all I can really ask for from a shooting game. The firefights themselves are challlenging, however they never seem to be unfair. I never really got frustrated, just more persistant. All in all, this is a very nice game. It has an amazing community and amazing mods that never cease to impress. A definite recommendation from me.

content:
r 10, 2015
												Although this game is pretty old, it is still fun and this game started half-life series...pros:-fantastic story-started the half-life series-excellent gameplay-quite a long game... which i like!-good gunplay-not many glitches-lots of guns-lots of enemies-lots of gore!-chapters to split the sections of the game-easy to run on a low-end pc (because it was made in 1998)-tones of ways to complete chapters or kill hard enemies-brilliant for when it was made-some amazing parts in the story-has a difficulty setting-most puzzles are easy-great apocalyptic setting-simplish gameplaycons:-old graphics, may concern some-hard for new FPS players-some difficult, long, brain-killing chapters-some shoddy parts in the storyP.S: I have not finished the full half-life series, but ALWAYS play this first if you are going to play all half-lifes.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
er 11, 2015
												this game is an absolute classic, and a classic at that.the level of immersion and architectual/aesthetic brilliance that went into making this game look the way it does now, still holds today, along with amazing amounts of replay value and silly mods that make the game all the more fun is, just amazing, how much it can enhance an already great experience. i know, I only have 1.2 hours on this account, but I can assure you i've played a little over 100, and haven't regretted a single hourit moves well, it shoots well, and overall, it's just fantastic. it discards the use of typical "quicktime" or portions of the game that are triggered to play a cutscene, and uses "scripted sequences" as a way of progressing through the game's storyline, which imo, adds to the already fantastic, fluid and straight-forward level of immersion this game creates for the playerthe feeling of progression, in a previously normal, yet semi not-so innocuous test research facility, located in the arid, and barren deserts of New Mexico, now overrun by hostile wildlife that once inhabited Xen after a failed experiment with the massive Anti-mass-spectrometer, all hell breaks loose, and you have to find your way out, through a series of brilliantly crafted corridors, large industrial toxic plants, treacherous cliffsides, across huge, immersive dams. and of course, the alien world inhabiting all the creatures you encountered, Xen. a huge interplanetary dimensional borderworld, scattered with large, floating rock structures to explore, of course, the designers at valve making us all ♥♥♥ immediately with their attention to detail...if anything this game, undoubtedly deserves the highest mark,  solid 10/10NEED IVAN THE SPACE BIKER FOR BEST EXPERIENCE ♥♥♥ U LAIDLAW BRING BACK IVAN DA SPACE BIKER 9/10

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
y 31, 2016
												What is there to say about this game other than it is one of the best first-person shooters out there. Now, In my opinion,  the second installment is a bit better, but this comes pretty damn close.The gun physics are incredible for the time and the puzzles are just the right level of difficulty. The enemies are challenging and the battle sequences are adrenaline filled shootouts.The only flaws are perhaps that the enemy AI is a bit derpy and the graphics, while mindblowing at the time, looks quite dated now, but I can look past dated graphics. The only reason I mention graphics, is that people who have never played this game before might be put off by the graphics. If your one of those people, consider purchasing "Black Mesa Source", as it is a remastered and probably definitive version of this game, although I still prefer the charm of the original.Overall, I friggen love this game and if you haven't played it yet, do so.

The story plays rather well however it is not as intense as the sequel in which the sequel is 11 years old (at this time). It is not very replayable however, it could be if it was open-world but that doesn't drive away from the feel of the game. Overall half-life is a welcome addition to my steam profile and it plays really well, i suggest giving it a try.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
er 1, 2016
												Short review:It’s an old game, and it sure does feel like it. However if you have the money and time, if you loved Half-Life 2, and if you don’t mind old games and everything that means. I recommend getting this, it is fun once you get passed the dated feel it has.Longer Review:Despite being a very old game (and quite noticeably so), I did enjoy it enough to complete it and for my purchase not being a waste of money. Due to it being dated, it might not be very enjoyable for some, however I still recommend playing this if you loved Half-Life 2 and sequels. I will probably not do a second playthrough, mostly because of time and there are many other games I’d like to experience, however it’s not something I’d avoid doing either. I recommend this game, because the only thing I dislike of it are the graphics, but it’s still a fun shooter and does help to set the stage and universe of the famed sequels. Buy it if you love HL2 and you don’t mind the feeling of playing an old game (and everything that means).*Update: Looks like I’m going with a second playthrough after all. First time it took me about 21 hours to complete, so far I got 2 hours in this time. I want to experience the game again fully, so I can play the series in order now that I got all of them :D Once I finish it this time however, I'll retire the game forever. Unless Valve surprises us with Half-Life 3.. in which case I'll go through the whole series again, but lets face it, that might never happen :'( DAMN YOU VALVE KILLING OUR DREAMS!

												About Half-Life:I have not played Half-Life until now. I have not even played any horror shooters or console games of the 20th Century. I could think Black Mesa is a good place to work, except for its poor layout, in office-ey terms. The enemy A.I is good. Although there's not as much guns as some other games out there, each weapon has its own stragety and abilites for attacking enemy strongholds.And now, I know why this game is a classic.Just like the description says: Run. content:
er 1, 2016
												Short review:It’s an old game, and it sure does feel like it. However if you have the money and time, if you loved Half-Life 2, and if you don’t mind old games and everything that means. I recommend getting this, it is fun once you get passed the dated feel it has.Longer Review:Despite being a very old game (and quite noticeably so), I did enjoy it enough to complete it and for my purchase not being a waste of money. Due to it being dated, it might not be very enjoyable for some, however I still recommend playing this if you loved Half-Life 2 and sequels. I will probably not do a second playthrough, mostly because of time and there are many other games I’d like to experience, however it’s not something I’d avoid doing either. I recommend this game, because the only thing I dislike of it are the graphics, but it’s still a fun shooter and does help to set the stage and universe of the famed sequels. Buy it if you love HL2 and you don’t mind the feeling of playing an old game (and everything that means).*Update: Looks like I’m going with a second playthrough after all. First time it took me about 21 hours to complete, so far I got 2 hours in this time. I want to experience the game again fully, so I can play the series in order now that I got all of them :D Once I finish it this time however, I'll retire the game forever. Unless Valve surprises us with Half-Life 3.. in which case I'll go through the whole series again, but lets face it, that might never happen :'( DAMN YOU VALVE KILLING OUR DREAMS!

content:
1, 2014
												There's not really much I can say about a fifteen year-old game that hasn't already been said, but Half-Life still holds up as a fantastic first-person shooter. The game has aged wonderfully, playing as a great mixture of arena classics like Quake and more "tactical" shooters such as Battlefield or Call of Duty, along with (very hit or miss) light platforming elements and occasional puzzle-solving. In the realm of modern shooters, looking back to classics like Half-Life is a great way to get to better understand how gaming has evolved and how changed many elements of gaming have become over the years.

												This game is one of the most revolutionary games ever made, it's like what Johnny B Goode (Just saying that song was amazing check it out if you haven't heard it's magic.)  was to Rock, it defined and set a new standard for FPS that came after. Valve's work on this game was why they have become such a dominate force in the gaming industry. Another reason why this game is so good was because of the amazing amount of mods made by the community, it's engine GoldSource made modding an easy task for the community, it had many great mods such as Counter Strike and Day of Defeat.Pros:Amazing gameplay.Never takes control away from the player, you always feel like YOU are Gordon Freeman.It's a center stone in the histroy of gaming altogether, as IGN said the FPS genre "breaks down pretty cleanly into pre-Half-Life and post-Half-Life eras."It's amazing community support and mods is overwhelming.Cons:They should incorporate Sven Co-Op into the game.Conclusion: This changed a lot of things in gaming and will always be remembered as a huge gaming step forward.Overall Rating: 9.9/10

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
2015
												This game is brilliant. It is one of my favorites and is worth every penny.Half-life is a First prson shooter that is clever. It is not a linear MMS (Modern military shooter) with things like "Hold F to pay respects" or "Wait here and shoot things while I do ♥♥♥♥ all". It has the same freedom as an older FPS like DOOM and alows you to explore but the enviroments are reaslistic (not strange mazes or Giant simpsons houses). So it is neither Guns ablazing or Linear. In Half-Life, you have to utilise a myriad of tactics in order to survive, such as conserving ammo and keeping an eye on your health. You also have to navigate dangerous enviroments such as; A dark office complex full of ailens and zombies, A blast pit with a creature in it that navigates by sound (You have to crouch and throw grenades to distract it), A residue processing plant with crushers and incinerators, a Warzone and many more. The enemy design is brilliant as they all have their own unique strategies and weaknesses. Below are some of my favorites.HEADCRABS: Small invertibrates that will walk slowly towards you and then POUNCE on you. There are the weakest enemies but if you get attacked by a group when you are on 6 Heath then you are boned.BARNACLES: Sea anenome-like creatures that camp on a celing and wait. If you touch their "Tounge" then they will pull you towards them and you get Eated to death. They love hiding in dark places or at the top of stairs...HECU MARINE: You do fight humans in this game and boy, are they something. Insead of running around waitng for you to gun them down they can take cover, flank you and use Underslung Grenades (They explode on impact, destroying you and your camping spot). They also like to hide and wait for you underneath stairs.................................................................................................................................campers.THERE ARE MORE ENEMIES BUT I DONT WANT YOU TO KNOW HOW TO FIGHT THEM YET :)Half-life arms you with info like this by showing you what an enemy does.[NITPICKING MODE ONLINE]There are some minor issues with this game. First of all is THE SAME FOUR SCIENTISTS  AND ONE SECURITY GUARD APPEAR EVERWHERE! Is Black mesa run by 6 People? Secondly, the graphics. I never judge a game by its graphics but if that is something you care about then your eyes may implode from the graphics. Please bear in mind that this is 1998 and the engine is a HEAVILY MODIFIED version of Id Tech II (Quake engine) so do give credit where credit is due.[NITPICKING OFF]To conclude Half-Life is brilliant in every possible way. (Apart from what i wrote above)FINAL SCORE 10/10Buy this game or Gman will give you a battle you cannot win.( ͡° ͜ʖ ͡°)

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
r 9, 2016
												Games such as Quake and Unreal Tournament may have been stepping stones in the evolution of first person shooter games, but Half Life was a breakthrough for the genre when it was released in 1999. Putting the player in total control of the entire experience from beginning to end without any interruptions makes this game a fine example of what you can only accomplish telling your story through a video game.On top of its presentational merits, the aspiring visionaries at Valve didn't slouch anywhere else either, pushing many machines to its limits with high resolution graphics in an era where digital distribution was only a pipe dream with dial-up connections.   It may seem dated by today's standards, but back then, this was unquestionably top of the line !I can't recommend Half Life enough for everything it managed to do, setting new standards across the board for everything thereafter !

content:
7, 2013
												Half-Life is the ultimate alien shooter out there. With an awesome story, a cool arsenal of weapons and enemies, and a wonderful gameplay,  mixed with a very low price for this jewel, make it a must have for every single human being on Earth, or every single Vortigaunt on Xen, or every single Advisor in the Combine Overworld. Either way, being from whichever planet you are, you should play this game. And it has a lot of expansions and mods for it. Having Desura installed alongside your Steam client is highly recommended for this one, since it allows you to install a lot of mods with a single click. And if you can get the Half-Life complete pack, then better, because these games are the best of the best.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
r 24, 2013
												The legendary FPS that started it all! It is easily described with its memorable tagline, "Run. Think. Shoot. Live." Let us analyze it in depth, now, shall we?"Run" - fast-paced action that slows only for puzzles"Think" - use your brain for clever mind-benders well-integrated into the game's combat as well as strategizing what weapons to use"Shoot" - self-explanatory. Excellent gunplay is excellent gunplay; not to mention each weapon is unique serving its own purpose."Live" - Add an "A" to the start of it, and that is how you will feel when you play this game thanks to the exceptional combination of everything above plus awesome sci-fi elements, story, soundtrack, and community-made modsEverything about this game is exceptional. I cannot emphasize how much you should try this game. Trust me, you won't be dissapointed.

content:
0, 2014
												Almost 20 years ago now, Half-Life released and it forever changed the First Person Shooter. Much has been said about HL and it's all true. Doom and Wolfenstein popularized the genre as a whole, and HL changed the way we saw level-design in FPS as a whole. A big, linear map and a background story made the game what it is and damn if it isn't one of the finest games out there. The game is cheap enough even outside sales, pick it up and enjoy one of the best games from generations before (just be careful of the underwater monster, heart-attack inducing ♥♥♥♥).

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
24, 2014
												This game still holds as one of the best first person shooters, specially because of it's multiplayer. It hasn't aged that well, unlike it's successor. Glitches in the single player campaign can be very annoying, but if you like old games, you must play this. It's a very long game, has little focus on story, so the action is nonstop as you travel trough a lot of different environments, the gameplay never gets boring. And if you already played Black Mesa Source, I still recommend this just because of the multiplayer.The multiplayer is very unique and fun. The different kinds of alien weaponry and the possibility to use some of then to move and jump around makes it very hard to master. I always return to play it because the multiplayer on modern war games always bores me, trying to be realistic and balanced, while in Half-Life you just make a mess with ridiculously overpowered weapons and movement mechanics, it's fast, it's awesome. Half-Life 2 Deathmatch was just not the same in comparison. If Valve decides to make Half-Life 3's multiplayer just like the first game, with more maps, more overpowered alien weapons, faster movement, and a remake of the crossfire map, it will be the best multiplayer game ever, outselling all Call of Duty games combined.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
y 31, 2014
												Half-Life is one of my favorite series. I've recomended this game to people before, and almost half of them didn't like it. Before buying Half Life 1, keep one thing in mind; it's a product of its time. Half-Life helped define modern FPS. The game, to me, is something special. I remember the first time I walked the desolate halls of Black Mesa. It's errie, dark, and full of government soldiers and wierd zombies and aliens. And you have no idea why all this ♥♥♥♥ is hitting the fan. Thats the greatness of it! What should have been a simple day of work turns into a hectic day of smashing things with crowbars and trying to survive within your workplace with a unique arsenal of weapons. It's really hard to compare this game with any other because it brings so many great expiriences to the table unlike any other game I've played before. Half Life gets an 8/10. Sure it may not be as refined as modern FPS games, but that doesn't matter. It's just a game you seriously need to expirience for yourself.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
er 15, 2013
												Wow... just... wow. What a game we have here. Playing this in the year of 2013 (After having played the wonderful Half-Life 2 some time ago), it's still a joyful experience. The awesome narrative, level design, gunplay and even artificial intelligence still work very well, making it easy to see just how incredibly ahead of its time the game was. Some things that stood out for me in particular were the level design, which changed drastically throughout the game and helped to keep things fresh, the intense (still to this day!) combat, and especially the enemies. Not only were there many different types of enemies, each one interesting and with their very own methods of attack, but for 1998 they were an extremely intelligent bunch of baddies- especially the Special Forces soldiers, who are constantly flanking and lobbing grenades. Not only that, but I found the mini-puzzles to be quite entertaining. All in all, this is one heck of a game, and there's no wonder it's been established as a masterpiece.
